Exaggerate: The claim that Democrats were at a 9/11 memorial service when NC Republicans held a controversial vote is exaggerated. Most Democrats were not at a 9/11 memorial service.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is only one Democrat, Rep. Garland Pierce, who claimed to be at a 9/11 event. No other Democrats have come forward to confirm their presence at a memorial service.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Republicans used a 9/11 memorial to trick Democrats into missing a key vote. However, there is no concrete evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the absence of Democrats during the vote. Most Democrats skipped the morning session because they believed it would be a non-voting session, based on information provided by Rep. David Lewis.
